among children under one year old per 1,000 live births.', 'Life expectancy: Average number of years a newborn is expected to live if current mortality rates continue.', 'Fertility rate: Average indicators into one composite statistic.', 'Nuclear reactor output: Measure of the amount of electricity generated by a nuclear power plant.', 'Radioactive half-life: The time required for half of the radioactive atoms in a sample to decay.', 'Uranium enrichment level: Percentage of uranium-235 compared to total uranium content.', 'Nuclear waste storage capacity: Total volume available for storing spent nuclear fuel and other radioactive waste.', 'Radiation exposure limit: The maximum amount of radiation a person can be exposed to safely over a certain time period.', 'Fallout area: Zone affected by the dispersal of radioactive particles following a nuclear event.', 'Atomic energy agreement terms: Legal and political conditions governing the use, sharing, or transfer of nuclear technology.', 'Nuclear non-proliferation treaty (NPT): An international treaty aimed at preventing the spread of nuclear weapons and promoting peaceful uses of nuclear energy.', 'Thermonuclear reaction: A fusion process that occurs under extreme temperatures, typically in stars or hydrogen bombs.']
